description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ddne0","text":"Larynx is a complex organ of voice production and respiration, which is supported by a series of cartilages, membranes, muscles and joints. They bring about movement of vocal cords with a considerable range of mobility. Apart from the phonating mechanism, it also serves as a sphincter or watch dog of the lower respiratory tract. The knowledge of laryngeal anatomy is important to various professionals such as phoniatricians, speech therapists, oncologists and otorhinolaryngologists. Understanding the laryngeal framework is mandatory in constructing biomechanical models for voice disorders that requires accurate\nlaryngeal dimensions. The data of the dimensions of thyroid cartilage, epiglottis and piriform fossa are\nessential to the anesthesiologists during the laryngoscopy and endotracheal intubation. However, they are scarce in the scientific literature. There are not many studies available about the measurements of thyroid cartilage, piriform fossa and epiglottis in our sample population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"ad6vs","text":"This study was approved by our institutional ethics committee.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6pruk","text":"This study was approved by the ethics committee of our institution (Approval\nCommittee Name: Institutional Ethics Committee, Kasturba Medical College,\nMangalore, Approval Number: IEC KMC MLR: 02/2022/61, dated 17.02.2022)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"9hlhh","text":"Study setting: Department
of Anatomy, Kasturba Medical College, Mangalore","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38b5c","text":"Study participants:
Human embalmed cadavers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buona","text":"Inclusion criteria: Adult human
embalmed cadavers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hshh","text":"Study duration: 3 months","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6koav","text":"Sample size: 22","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o9p2","text":"Sampling method: The
sample size is similar to the earlier study performed by Eckel et al. (1994).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8apmv","text":"Data collection methodology:
A digital Vernier caliper (Mitutoyo,
Japan, 0-150 mm 500-196) will be used to perform
the measurements. Height, width and
thickness of the thyroid cartilage, epiglottis and piriform fossa will be
measured. The measurements will be taken at their maximum diameter and for the
thyroid cartilage and piriform fossa, the readings will be taken separately
over the right and left sides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28},{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfsd8","text":"Data analysis: The
data will be presented as mean ± standard deviation and the side-based
comparison of the right and left sides will be performed by using the paired
‘t’ test. The recent version of SPSS
(version 27) software will be utilized for the
statistical analysis. The gender-based comparison and age wise segregation will
not be performed in the present study. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Acta Otolaryngol. 1988; 105(1-2): 155-162.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95f3k","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8be6i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m1k8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l2lc","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Morphometry of thyroid cartilage, epiglottis and pyriform fossa
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6nkcg","text":"    The goal of this study will be to obtain\nthe dimensions of thyroid cartilage, epiglottis and piriform sinus in embalmed\ncadavers of Indian sample population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
